Incidents.Name: Lockheed Fire
Incidents.Location: Bonny Doon area - Smith Drainage
Incidents.ConditionStatement:
Fire crews have contained the remaining open fire line in the southern region. Threat levels remain low in the Bonny Doon and Swanton areas. However, residents should remain alert to possible fire activity occurring in and around the fire area. If anyone witnesses a large amount of smoke production in the burn area, call the Lockheed Fire Information Line at 831-335-0378.Lingering smoke will be present as fire crews continue to fully control the incident. We would like residents driving in the communities affected by the fire to remain cautious of the fire personnel and equipment working to extinguish the fire. Additionally, residents need to be cautious when walking in or near the burned area. Smoldering brush and stumps may be found and are still dangerous. Heavy mop-up is continuing for all other areas of the fire. A damage assessment was completed. Structures damaged/destroyed include 4 seasonal cabins.

On behalf of the CAL FIRE Incident Command Team 9, we would like to thank the residents of Bonny Doon, Davenport and the Swanton and Last Chance areas. Your patience and understanding during the evacuation assisted the firefighters in extinguishing the wildfire that threatened the area. We encourage all residents to comply with the 100 foot clearances around all structures
Incidents.SearchDescription: In August, the Lockheed Fire burned 7,817 acres in the Bonny Doon and Swanton areas of Santa Cruz County.
Incidents.SearchKeywords: Lockheed Fire, Bonny Doon, Santa Cruz County, Swanton
Incidents.AdminUnit: CAL FIRE San Mateo - Santa Cruz Unit

Incidents.Name: September Lightning Series Fires
Incidents.Location: Across northern and central California
Incidents.ConditionStatement:
Since Saturday there have been over 1,500 lightning strikes across northern and central California. As a result over 81 confirmed fires have sparked in CAL FIRE's jurisdiction. 
Santa Clara Unit - 20 fires, 200 acres, all contained. 
Sonoma-Lake-Napa Unit - 9 fires, 10 acres, all contained. 
Mendocino Unit - 2 fires, 11 acres, both contained. 
Amador-Eldorado Unit - 5 fires, 12 acres, all contained. 
Tuolumne-Calaveras Unit - 7 fires, all contained; The Telegraph Fire near Cooperopolis is 200 acres, fully contained, the San Antonio Fire near Arnold is 5 acres, fully contained. 
Madera-Mariposa-Merced Unit - 2 fires, the Hunter Fire is 3 acres, fully contained and the Horseshoe Fire is 1 acre, fully contained. 
Siskiyou Unit - 3 fires, all contained. 
Continued monitoring and patrol of existing fires as needed, and suppression of any new fires as identified.
Incidents.SearchDescription: In September, the September Lightning Series Fires contained 81 fires across northern and central California in Multiple Counties.
Incidents.SearchKeywords: September Lightning Series Fires

ListIncidents.Name: Lockheed Fire
ListIncidents.Location: Bonny Doon area - Smith Drainage
ListIncidents.ConditionStatement:
Fire crews have contained the remaining open fire line in the southern region. Threat levels remain low in the Bonny Doon and Swanton areas. However, residents should remain alert to possible fire activity occurring in and around the fire area. If anyone witnesses a large amount of smoke production in the burn area, call the Lockheed Fire Information Line at 831-335-0378.Lingering smoke will be present as fire crews continue to fully control the incident. We would like residents driving in the communities affected by the fire to remain cautious of the fire personnel and equipment working to extinguish the fire. Additionally, residents need to be cautious when walking in or near the burned area. Smoldering brush and stumps may be found and are still dangerous. Heavy mop-up is continuing for all other areas of the fire. A damage assessment was completed. Structures damaged/destroyed include 4 seasonal cabins.

On behalf of the CAL FIRE Incident Command Team 9, we would like to thank the residents of Bonny Doon, Davenport and the Swanton and Last Chance areas. Your patience and understanding during the evacuation assisted the firefighters in extinguishing the wildfire that threatened the area. We encourage all residents to comply with the 100 foot clearances around all structures
ListIncidents.SearchDescription: In August, the Lockheed Fire burned 7,817 acres in the Bonny Doon and Swanton areas of Santa Cruz County.
ListIncidents.SearchKeywords: Lockheed Fire, Bonny Doon, Santa Cruz County, Swanton
ListIncidents.AdminUnit: CAL FIRE San Mateo - Santa Cruz Unit

ListIncidents.Name: September Lightning Series Fires
ListIncidents.Location: Across northern and central California
ListIncidents.ConditionStatement:
Since Saturday there have been over 1,500 lightning strikes across northern and central California. As a result over 81 confirmed fires have sparked in CAL FIRE's jurisdiction. 
Santa Clara Unit - 20 fires, 200 acres, all contained. 
Sonoma-Lake-Napa Unit - 9 fires, 10 acres, all contained. 
Mendocino Unit - 2 fires, 11 acres, both contained. 
Amador-Eldorado Unit - 5 fires, 12 acres, all contained. 
Tuolumne-Calaveras Unit - 7 fires, all contained; The Telegraph Fire near Cooperopolis is 200 acres, fully contained, the San Antonio Fire near Arnold is 5 acres, fully contained. 
Madera-Mariposa-Merced Unit - 2 fires, the Hunter Fire is 3 acres, fully contained and the Horseshoe Fire is 1 acre, fully contained. 
Siskiyou Unit - 3 fires, all contained. 
Continued monitoring and patrol of existing fires as needed, and suppression of any new fires as identified.
ListIncidents.SearchDescription: In September, the September Lightning Series Fires contained 81 fires across northern and central California in Multiple Counties.
ListIncidents.SearchKeywords: September Lightning Series Fires
